narrative_summary: Over the past 48 hours, there has been a noticeable surge in drone-related incidents primarily linked to smuggling activities and airport disruptions. Key incidents included the IDF intercepting drones allegedly carrying weapons from Jordan and a drone drop of 12 kg of heroin near Amritsar, highlighting ongoing cross-border smuggling trends. Additionally, a series of arrests related to unauthorized drone activities occurred in Thailand, underscoring security concerns at airports. Multiple incidents of drone crashes were reported, including one that caused damage to an apartment building in Chernihiv, drawing attention to the risks associated with drone operations in conflict zones. The growing prevalence of drone surveillance and enforcement actions against illegal drones are also significant themes emerging from these incidents.
